content: Traditional methods of capturing engineering team knowledge (wikis, READMEs, onboarding docs) often become stale quickly because the effort of documentation is deprioritized compared to shipping features.

Stale documentation leads to longer ramp-up times for new engineers, senior engineers repeatedly answering the same questions, and recurring mistakes due to conventions residing only in individuals' minds.
@cognition captures knowledge as a side effect of engineers making corrections, rather than requiring dedicated documentation writing.
When an engineer corrects an AI agent (e.g., @DevinAI) with a specific instruction, the system suggests saving that correction as a knowledge item for future retrieval across the organization.
The @cognition system allows knowledge to emerge from natural corrections, eliminating the need for engineers to consciously think about documentation while working.
Knowledge can be auto-generated by Devin scanning repository contents like READMEs, file structures, and specific configuration files (AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md, .cursorrules, .rules files).
The system supports updates to existing knowledge items, allowing the knowledge base to evolve with changing conventions.
Knowledge can be manually added directly via the UI or API to codify information upfront.

The described system allows team conventions, deployment quirks, internal library preferences, and common pitfalls to accumulate organically from corrections, rather than through explicit documentation efforts.
A new engineer using this system can benefit from the accumulated team conventions immediately through the agent, without needing to read documentation or search communication channels.
